Commentary: runs in quick and fires in a back of a length ball that is pushed across and beats the outside edge

Commentary: back of a length, lot closer to off-stump than the first two. Slightly squares up the batsman and beats the outside edge
Commentary_short: Taylor to Noor Ali Zadran, no run

Commentary: now he tries to get the front leg out of the way and swings wildly. He had to move closer to the ball. Instead, he goes away from it and ends up making no contact
Commentary_short: Taylor to Noor Ali Zadran, no run

Commentary: finally come contact. And it's a short ball on leg and middle, around chest height, pulled away through the backward square leg

Commentary: Taylor switches back to the outside off channel but pushes it across at a very full length. Noor Ali is able to get behind it through and carts it uppishly through covers for four

Commentary: advances down the track to minimise the sin and defends to covers

Commentary: stays back to this length ball and tucks it away into the leg side for one

Commentary: too full to sweep. Bang on the stumps so not much room too, really. Gets hit on the back pad and it seemed pretty plumb. The umpire doesn't take too long to give it out. 50th wicket for Badree in T20 cricket.

Commentary: fuller ball, defended from in front of outside off down the pitch

Commentary: poor delivery. Overcompensates with the line and fires it on leg stump. Too full as well and it is clipped effortlessly off the pads through backward square leg

Commentary: short of good length, pitched outside leg stump, gets outside the line and easily trickles it down fine for four

Williams bowls smartly to take the pace off and darts it in very full on the stumps. Noor Ali is so far across there is really not much he can do about it. Tries to stick out the bat with his left hand and makes no contact as the ball crashes into the stumps

Commentary: appeal for leg before and given. But was that heading down leg? It was a length ball, angled in, Lewis shifts back but there is no turn on the ball. Just comes on with the arm. And it also drifts in a little before pitching which exaggerated the angle. The umpire has a long, hard look before raising his finger. Could it have gone down leg?
Commentary_short: Mohammad Nabi to Lewis, OUT
Dismissal_text: E Lewis lbw b Mohammad Nabi 19 (22b 1x4 1x6) SR: 86.36

Commentary: deep midwicket makes a mess of this pull from Samuels. Short ball. Samuels pulls firmly and Rashid runs in and slides but the ball drops in front of him and he misses the catch and also fails to stop it as he is sliding forward. The ball died on him early enough, so maybe he should have just looked to stop the boundary. Fifty for Samuels

Commentary: lucky boundary. Backs away and the bowler follows him with a length ball. Looks to heave it over the leg side but the ball takes the bottom edge of a half-angled bat and evades the keeper diving to his left. Away to fine leg. Expensive over from Shapoor

Commentary: this one's even better. Harmless length ball, Samuels rocks back and swats a pull over deep midwicket. Struck big and with authority

Commentary: is that a run out? Should have been a four, really. Samuels drills a fuller ball straight down the ground. It hits the bat of the non-striker as he tries to get out of the way and goes towards mid-off. Mohammed has no idea about where the ball is and takes off. Samuels sends him back and he has managed to make it back
